div.bibl: Vita Nuova, October 1929, p. 24. "AT THE CHICAGO COMMONS."

body.p: On Thursday, September 19th,a meeting was held at the Chicago Commons, at 945 W. Grand Ave. founded and directed for the last forty years by Graham Taylor, which was attended by many of our countrymen lead by our Italian Consul General, Dr. Castruccio.
Everyone was cordially welcomed by the organizing committee composed of Dr. Taylor, Atty. Ungaro, A. Romano, Prof. J.F. Militello, V. Ottolino and M. Nardulli.
A speech was delivered by the Consul General and it was resolved to organize and found an institution for the propagation of Italo-American culture in Chicago.
